bibl.title: Roman Artillery Balls from Qasr Ibrim, Egypt.
bibl.note: 1. The Roman occupation of the fortress. - 2. Review of excavation results. - 3. The re-examination of the 1978 and 1980 stone balls. - 4a. Stones with carbon ink inscriptions [in Greek script]. - 4b. Balls with incised markings. - 5. The importance of the find: the ballistae and the ballistarii. - 6. The end of the campaign.
bibl.seg: WILKINS Alan, Hans BARNARD and Pamela J. ROSE, Roman Artillery Balls from Qasr Ibrim, Egypt.
Sudan & Nubia 10 (2006) pp. 66-80, 1 tabl., 2 diagrammes, 8 figg., 1 carte, 2 pll.

1. The Roman occupation of the fortress. - 2. Review of excavation results. - 3. The re-examination of the 1978 and 1980 stone balls. - 4a. Stones with carbon ink inscriptions [in Greek script]. - 4b. Balls with incised markings. - 5. The importance of the find: the ballistae and the ballistarii. - 6. The end of the campaign.
